title: python package not active in environment

labels.name: triage
labels.description: The issue needs to be prioritized

body:
I created a python package for mpltools. When I add this package to an environment, it is not accessible to python. However, when I use `spack load py-mpltools` everything works as expected.

I'm not sure if the issue is related to the upstream `setup.py`, or my spack package. The spack package I created can be found [here](https://github.com/jacobmerson/spack/blob/a67bf0ca77b33f742c4650c6b4ba5e64739266ff/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/py-mpltools/package.py)


### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack env activate mypy # py-mpltools not active after loading an environment with the package in it
$ spack load py-mpltools # py-mpltools is now accessible
```

### Error Message

No errors reported, stacktrace looks normal. However, py-mpltools is not accessible when running python.
```console
$ python3 -c "import mpltools"
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<string>", line 1, in <module>
ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'mpltools'
```

### Information on your system

* **Spack:** 0.16.0-31-a67bf0ca7
* **Python:** 3.8.5
* **Platform:** linux-ubuntu20.04-broadwell
* **Concretizer:** original

I use the external python 3.8.5 installation with ubuntu 20.04

### Additional information
- [x] I have run `spack debug report` and reported the version of Spack/Python/Platform
- [x] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
- [x] I have run the failing commands in debug mode and reported the output

@adamjstewart
